item.title: 微软将用谷歌高管加洛特接替安全主管贝尔
item.description: 微软公司安全主管查理·贝尔将转任专注于工程质量的新个人贡献者职位，其职位将由谷歌云部门的一位高管接替。【原文：Microsoft Corp. security chief Charlie Bell is moving to a new individual contributor role focused on engineering quality and will be replaced by an executive from Google’s cloud unit.】

item.title: 英伟达首席执行官：软件抛售是"世界上最不合逻辑的事情"
item.description: 英伟达公司首席执行官黄仁勋表示，本周软件公司股价因市场担忧人工智能颠覆性影响而遭遇抛售，这种现象毫无道理。该公司设备在全球人工智能数据中心建设中占据核心地位。【原文：Nvidia Corp. Chief Executive Officer Jensen Huang, leader of the company’s whose gear is central to the worldwide buildout of artificial intelligence data centers, said this week’s selloff in the shares of software companies amid concerns about AI disruption makes no sense.】

item.title: 据称埃隆·马斯克的SpaceX公司已向非美国银行开放IPO推介
item.description: 知情人士透露，SpaceX已就首次公开募股事宜与美国以外的银行举行会议。这家由埃隆·马斯克创立的火箭与卫星制造商正以雄心勃勃的时间表，计划在今年实现上市。【原文：SpaceX held meetings with banks from outside the US for its IPO, according to people familiar with the matter, as Elon Musk’s rocket and satellite maker targets a listing this year on an ambitious timeline.】

item.title: 共和党关键参议员称鲍威尔作证未触犯法律
item.description: 共和党参议员蒂姆·斯科特表示，美联储主席杰罗姆·鲍威尔去年夏天在国会听证会上回答问题时并未触犯法律。【原文：Republican Senator Tim Scott said Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell didn’t commit a crime when answering questions during a congressional hearing last summer.】

item.title: 新西兰房价跌至30个月低点，买家持观望态度
item.description: 新西兰房价在1月份连续第二个月下跌，创下两年半以来的最低水平，因购房者在对经济复苏更有把握之前仍持观望态度。【原文：New Zealand house prices fell for a second straight month in January, hitting a two-and-a-half year low as buyers stay on the sidelines until they are more assured about the economic recovery.】

item.title: 美国劳工统计局宣布，原定1月的就业报告将推迟至2月11日发布
item.description: 美国劳工统计局表示，原定于1月份发布的就业报告已重新安排至2月11日发布。【原文：The January employment report has been rescheduled for Feb. 11, according to the Bureau of Labor Statistics.】

item.title: 调查显示，受委内瑞拉动荡影响，欧佩克上月产量下降
item.description: 彭博社调查显示，由于动荡局势抑制了委内瑞拉的出口，同时其他成员国开始实施为期三个月的产量冻结，欧佩克上月原油产量出现下滑。【原文：OPEC’s crude output declined last month as turmoil curbed Venezuela’s exports while other members began a three-month production freeze, a Bloomberg survey showed.】

item.title: 当下正发生着两种解体现象
item.description: 您好，欢迎阅读本期通讯，这里汇集了Odd Lots世界每日精选内容。有时是我们——乔·韦森塔尔和特蕾西·阿洛威——为您解读市场、金融与经济领域的最新动态；有时则是来自我们专家嘉宾及信息源网络的深度贡献。无论内容形式如何，我们承诺始终为您带来精彩内容。【原文：Hello and welcome to the newsletter, a grab bag of daily content from the Odd Lots universe. Sometimes it's us, Joe Weisenthal and Tracy Alloway, bringing you our thoughts on the most recent developments in markets, finance and the economy. And sometimes it's contributions from our network of expert guests and sources. Whatever it is, we promise it will always be interesting.】

item.title: 欧洲化工股因排放规则乐观情绪大涨
item.description: 欧洲化工股创下近四年最佳单日表现，因市场对该地区减排规则可能放宽的乐观预期，推动资金转向增长前景改善的企业。【原文：Europe’s chemical stocks had their best day in almost four years as optimism for softer emission-reduction rules in the region added to a broader rotation toward companies geared to improving growth prospects.】

item.title: 墨西哥石油公司债务降至11年低点，墨西哥期待石油行业复苏
item.description: 墨西哥国家石油公司（Pemex）的债务降至11年来最低水平，这对这家陷入困境的国有石油公司而言是个积极信号。该公司正致力于扭转持续数十年的产量下滑趋势，并重振亏损的炼油业务。【原文：Mexico’s Petroleos Mexicanos reduced its debt to the lowest level in 11 years, a hopeful sign for the struggling state-owned oil company as it seeks to reverse a decades-long production decline and revive its money-losing refining business.】

item.title: Cerebras以230亿美元估值完成10亿美元融资
item.description: 人工智能芯片供应商Cerebras Systems公司在新一轮融资中筹集了约10亿美元资金，这将增强该公司与英伟达公司竞争的能力。【原文：AI chip provider Cerebras Systems Inc. has raised about $1 billion in a new funding round, bolstering the company’s efforts to compete with Nvidia Corp.】

item.title: OpenClaw用户称AI失控，凸显智能体风险
item.description: 软件工程师克里斯·博伊德在一月底因大雪困在北卡罗来纳州的家中时，开始研究一款名为OpenClaw的数字个人助理。他利用该程序制作每日新闻摘要，并设置为每天清晨5:30自动发送至他的收件箱。【原文：Chris Boyd, a software engineer, began tinkering with a digital personal assistant called OpenClaw at the end of January, while he was snowed in at his North Carolina home. He used it to create a daily digest of relevant news stories and send them to his inbox every morning at 5:30 a.m.】

item.title: 美国地区性银行股价攀升至历史新高，轮动行情持续扩大
item.description: 美国地区性银行股周三延续近期涨势，盘中创下历史新高，因资金从大型银行转向小型贷款机构的轮动趋势持续加剧。【原文：US regional bank stocks extended their recent rally Wednesday to reach an all-time intraday high as the rotation out of large caps and into smaller lenders intensifies.】

item.title: 中国对欧盟风电补贴调查提出"严重关切"
item.description: 中国批评欧盟对中国风电企业补贴展开深入调查，称此举具有保护主义性质，并誓言将采取行动维护国家利益。【原文：China criticized the European Union’s in-depth probe into subsidies for Chinese wind power companies, calling the move protectionist and vowing it would take action to protect the country’s interests.】

item.title: 非洲进出口银行行长淡化惠誉垃圾级评级下调影响
item.description: 非洲进出口银行行长乔治·埃隆比对惠誉评级将该行信用评级下调至垃圾级不以为意，称其财务状况依然稳健，并将继续支持政府政策重点。【原文：African Export-Import Bank President George Elombi shrugged off Fitch Ratings’ downgrade of the lender’s credit to junk, saying its finances remain solid and it will continue to support government policy priorities.】

item.title: 美国股市下跌，AMD财报与人工智能担忧拖累市场情绪
item.description: 美国股市下跌，交易员们正评估人工智能驱动的软件公司抛售潮造成的损失，并仔细研读最新财报。【原文：US stocks declined as traders assessed the damage from the artificial intelligence-driven selloff in software firms and poured over the latest earnings reports.】

item.title: 多伦多房市年初下跌，买家纷纷撤离
item.description: 多伦多房市年初走低，成交量与房价双双下滑，市场对房地产短期内反弹的预期持续降温。【原文：Toronto’s housing market dropped to start the year, with both sales and prices dipping, amid deepening skepticism real estate is due for a rebound anytime soon.】

item.title: 米莱力推全民美元贷款，打破阿根廷禁忌
item.description: 总统哈维尔·米莱正试图打破阿根廷最大的金融禁忌之一：向非美元收入的个人和企业提供美元贷款。【原文：President Javier Milei is looking to sweep aside one of Argentina’s biggest financial taboos: offering dollar loans to people and companies that don’t earn in dollars.】

item.title: 美国服务业保持2024年以来最快增速
item.description: 上月美国服务业企业连续两个月实现最强劲增长，创2024年以来新高，商业活动持续回暖。【原文：US service providers registered the strongest back-to-back growth since 2024 last month as business activity picked up.】

item.title: 拉丁美洲独角兽企业Clara任命Point72前副总裁为首席财务官
item.description: 金融科技初创企业Clara——这家总部位于圣保罗的企业支出管理公司——任命前Point72副总裁特拉维斯·福克斯霍尔为其首席财务官。【原文：Financial technology startup Clara, a corporate spending management firm based in Sao Paulo, named former Point72 vice president Travis Foxhall as its chief financial officer.】

item.title: 野村证券率先呼吁土耳其暂停降息
item.description: 野村控股公司土耳其经济学家表示，该国央行将在下次会议暂停降息。【原文：Nomura Holdings Inc’s Turkey economist said the central bank will have to pause its interest-rate cutting in its next meeting.】

item.title: 俄罗斯石油收入因制裁和卢布贬值跌至五年低点
item.description: 俄罗斯政府1月份的石油收入跌至五年多来的最低水平，全球油价疲软、该国原油折扣加剧以及本币走强对预算造成了冲击。【原文：The Russian government’s oil revenues collapsed to the lowest in more than five years in January as weaker global prices, steeper discounts for the nation’s barrels, and a stronger currency took a toll on the budget.】

item.title: 贝森特将就美国经济政策在众议院小组委员会作证
item.description: 美国财政部长斯科特·贝森特摄影师：埃里克·李/彭博社【原文：US Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent Photographer: Eric Lee/Bloomberg】

item.title: 亿万富翁伊什比亚为新工业基金筹集4亿美元
item.description: 由亿万富翁贾斯汀·伊什比亚创立的芝加哥私募股权公司Shore Capital Partners，已为其第二只工业基金筹集逾4亿美元资金。【原文：Shore Capital Partners, a Chicago-based private equity firm founded by billionaire Justin Ishbia, has raised more than $400 million for its second industrial fund.】

item.title: Adobe将广告支出增至14亿美元以应对人工智能引发的担忧
item.description: 面对激烈的市场竞争以及华尔街对其在人工智能时代沦为失败者的质疑，Adobe公司于2025年大幅增加广告投入，斥资14亿美元推广品牌。【原文：Adobe Inc. ramped up its advertising in 2025, spending $1.4 billion to promote its brand in the face of steep competition and skepticism from Wall Street that the company is a loser in the age of AI.】

item.title: 亚马逊在美国为Prime会员推出人工智能增强版Alexa
item.description: 亚马逊公司正在美国推出升级版Alexa，为付费Prime会员提供增强型人工智能数字助理服务，同时面向其他用户推出免费版本。【原文：Amazon.com Inc. is taking the wrapper off its upgraded Alexa in the US, offering the AI-enhanced digital assistant to paying Prime customers and introducing a free version for everyone else.】

item.title: 莫塔股价飙升，尽管做空压力持续增大
item.description: 做空葡萄牙建筑公司Mota-Engil SGPS SA的股票正成为一项日益拥挤的交易，尽管自激进做空机构浑水首次披露其仓位以来，该股股价已持续攀升。【原文：Betting against the shares of Portuguese construction firm Mota-Engil SGPS SA is becoming an increasingly crowded trade, even as the stock has climbed since activist short seller Muddy Waters first disclosed its position.】

item.title: 波兰央行再度按兵不动，经济加速增长
item.description: 波兰央行维持利率不变，在经济增长意外强劲后，连续第二个月暂停宽松周期。【原文：Poland’s central bank kept interest rates steady, pausing its easing cycle for a second month, after unexpectedly strong economic growth.】

item.title: 美国坚持发行短期国债，未来数个季度不会提高中期票据和债券发行量
item.description: 美国财政部在债务发行策略上未作重大调整，符合交易商预期。此前市场曾猜测官员们可能采取措施降低长期借贷成本。【原文：The US Treasury refrained from any major shift in its debt-issuance strategy, meeting dealers’ expectations in the face of speculation that officials might take steps to bring down longer-term borrowing costs.】

item.title: 科技巨头在美国电力账单上的承诺仍存诸多疑问
item.description: 像OpenAI这样的公司，其承诺的落实缺乏明确的机制保障。【原文：There’s no clear mechanism for a company like OpenAI to follow through on its commitments.】
